metadata.title: CVE-2019-13602 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An Integer Underflow in MP4_EIA608_Convert() in modules/demux/mp4/mp4.c inVideoLAN VLC media player through 3.0.7.1 allows remote attackers to causea denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow and crash) or possibly haveunspecified other impact via a crafted .mp4 file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13602` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvlc-bin - 3.0.7.1-3
libvlc5 - 3.0.7.1-3
libvlccore9 - 3.0.7.1-3
vlc - 3.0.7.1-3
vlc-bin - 3.0.7.1-3
vlc-data - 3.0.7.1-3
vlc-l10n - 3.0.7.1-3
vlc-plugin-access-extra - 3.0.7.1-3
vlc-plugin-base - 3.0.7.1-3
vlc-plugin-fluidsynth - 3.0.7.1-3
vlc-plugin-jack - 3.0.7.1-3
vlc-plugin-notify - 3.0.7.1-3
vlc-plugin-qt - 3.0.7.1-3
vlc-plugin-samba - 3.0.7.1-3
vlc-plugin-skins2 - 3.0.7.1-3
vlc-plugin-svg - 3.0.7.1-3
vlc-plugin-video-output - 3.0.7.1-3
vlc-plugin-video-splitter - 3.0.7.1-3
vlc-plugin-visualization - 3.0.7.1-3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vlc package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.7.1-3').
